 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֹר‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מוֺר‎</span> **noun masculine**<sup>[[Song.5.5|Song 5:5]]</sup> ==myrrh== (from ***bitter*** taste; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***murru***</u></abbr> [[BDB#Meissn|Meissn]]<sup>Suppl. 60</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; compare [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>BN 40</sup>); — absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֹר‎</span> [[Ps.45.9|Ps 45:9]] + 5 t., <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מוֺר‎</span> [[Song.4.6|Song 4:6]] + 3 t. Cant; construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָרֿ‎</span> [[Exod.30.23|Exod 30:23]] suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מוֺרִי‎</span> [[Song.5.1|Song 5:1]] — ***myrrh*** (late), an Arabian gum, exuding from the bark of a tree, ***Balsamodendron Myrrha*** (see Sigismund<sup>Aromata 12 f.</sup> [[BDB#Ri|Ri]]<sup>HWB under the word</sup>): — as flowing, i.e. fine, choice (carefully prepared by pressing and mixing, compare [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>[[Exod.30.23|Exod 30:23]]</sup> [[BDB#Ri|Ri]]<sup>HWB</sup>): <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָרדְּֿרוֺר‎</span> [[Exod.30.23|Exod 30:23]] (see I.  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דְּרוֺר‎</span>), ingredient of sacred oil; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מוֺר עֹבֵר‎</span> [[Song.5.5|Song 5:5]]; [[Song.5.13|Song 5:13]] (as perfume); compare (as perfume) [[Song.1.13|Song 1:13]]; [[Song.4.14|Song 4:14]]; [[Song.5.1|Song 5:1]]; [[Song.5.5|Song 5:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַרהַֿמּוֺר‎</span> [[Song.4.6|Song 4:6]], i.e. where it is gathered; as perfume also [[Ps.45.9|Ps 45:9]]; [[Prov.7.17|Prov 7:17]], as incense <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְקֻטֶּרֶת מֹר וּלְבֹנָה‎</span> [[Song.3.6|Song 3:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֶׁמֶן הַמּוֺר‎</span> as unguent [[Esth.2.12|Esth 2:12]].
